msDesc.head: Augustinus de Ancona, Theological texts on Virgin Mary, Sermons; Germany, 15th century

physDesc.p: Composite: three parts fols. 1-82 || fols. 83-206 || fols. 207-338 ||

supportDesc.extent: 352 leaves (fols. 68, 77, 78, 131, 135, 146, 160 are double; fols. 74, 125, 136 are treble)

history.provenance: Erfurt, Carthusian abbey of St. Salvator: inscription, Pertinet hic liber ad carthus' erfford (front pastedown).
history.acquisition: Presented to the Bodleian Library by his sons and received in 1857.

recordHist.source:
Description adapted by Tuija Ainonen (May 2020) from the following sources (with additional description of ex libris on front pastedown, description of contents and physical description):
Unpublished description by Stephen Mossman, c. 2003 [description of the cotent in German].
Summary Catalogue, Vol. 5, p. 38 Summary Catalogue, Vol. 5, p. 39

msItem.author: Augustinus de Ancona
msItem.title: Tractatus de angelica annuntiatione
msItem.rubric: Augustinus de Anchona super angelicam salutationem (rubric in the table of contents, front pastedown)
msItem.incipit: Quatuor mihi tremorem ac timorem faciunt loqui de virgine gloriosa
msItem.explicit: in hora mortis nostrae nobis acquirat salvatorem. Amen.

msItem.title: Theological questiones on Ave Maria
msItem.incipit: Missus est angelus Gabriel a Deo. Utrum conueniens fuerit angelum ad virginem mitti

msItem.title: Sermons and questiones on the Assumption of Virgin
Theological questiones on the Assumption of Virgin
msItem.incipit: Sed hic triplex occurrit questio

msItem.rubric: De assumptione beate Marie semper virginis sermones boni
msItem.incipit: Misit de summo excelsis ... Pro impetranda gratia dicamus ... In hac cantilena dauitica introducitur mundi domina quadriformiter admiranda

msItem.title: Alphabetical index to fols. 1-74
msItem.incipit:
Abel
Abraham adorauit angelos
Accepcio personarum
Adam

msItem.author: Iohannes Andreae
msItem.title: Apparatus ad Clementinas (?)
msItem.rubric: Scripta quedam Johannis Andree de sacro Altare et ceteris multis (ascription in the table of contents, front pastedown)
msItem.incipit: Nota omnia que hic subsequntur scribit Iohannis Andree in glosa super causam unicum Si dominum in sanctis eius laudare iubemur

msItem.title: Sermons
msItem.rubric: Sermo aduentus Domini primus. aliter de natiuitate Christi.
msItem.incipit: Videbunt filium hominis venientem in nubibus. Luc. 21. Unde dicit in sermone: Fratres mei non solum cogitetis adventum domini

msItem.title: Index of the preceding sermons
msItem.note: Arranged under topics: De aduentu domini sermones (sermons 1-5), In die palmarum (sermons 6-12), De dedicatione ecclesie (sermons 13-20), De corpore Christi sermones (sermons 21-34), Apostolorum Petri et Pauli sermones (sermons 35-42), De sancto Benedicto sermones (semrons 43-46, with 45 lacking), De sancto Bernhardo sermones (sermons 47-61 , with 48, 51, 55, 57, 60 lacking), De visitatione sermones (sermons 62-86, with 65, 66, 68, 73, 75, 80, 85 lacking, and 70, 74, 82, 86 numbered twice), De electione priorum sermones (sermons 88-92).

msItem.title: Alphabetical index of key words
msItem.incipit: Aa ... Abymeleth ... Abscondes eos ... Abstinentia

msItem.title: Testamentum XII patriarcharum
msItem.rubric: Extracta de testamento 12 patriarcharum (from the table of contents, front pastedown)
msItem.incipit: (fol. 82r) Ambulemus in simplicitate cordis quoniam per eam omnem beneplacentiam Dei perficimus
(fol. 193r) Dico vobis filii mei ut fugiatis odium et adheretis dilectioni
msItem.note: Excerpts, added slightly later than the main part of the book.

msItem.rubric: Incipit iam sermo de sancta Maria Magdalena
msItem.incipit: Non est talis super terram in aspectu et pulchritudine et in sensu verborum. Iudith xi. Verba proposita conuenienter assumuntur pro laude et preconio beate Marie Magdalene, in quibus verbis tripliciter commendatur et attollitur
Dilectus Deo et hominibus Moyses ... Recte per Moysen sanctus Iacobus intelligitur quia uterque ex aque assumptis
msItem.note: Schneyer 1. 655 (Bonaventura, 969); Schneyer 5. 386 (Servasanctus de Faenza, 166); Schneyer 7. 316 (Sermones Fratrum Min. Clm 7779 no. 273).

msItem.incipit: Et erit sepulchrum eius gloriosum. Ysaie xi. Sicut patet ex superiorore et ad sensum cernimus tota die, nullius sancti sepulchrum sic est aput homines gloriosum
Surge velociter. Act. xii. Cum liberatio Petri apostoli facta fuerit in die dominice incarnytionis
Probauit me quasi aurum quod transit per ignem. Iob 23. Miror ualde modo quare beatus Laurencius significatur in auro ignis in auro maximo calore probato
Igne me examinasti ... Ps. Inter omnia elementa ignis est actiuus eo quod plus ceteris habeat de forma et minus de materia
Aamice ascende superius. Luc. 14. Dicit Tulius et Valerius Maximus quod amicicia propinquitati prefertur eo quod a propinquitate amor removeri potest
Posuisti Domine super caput eius coronam de lapide precioso. Psalmista triplex corona legitur esse in scriptura, una aurea, altera stellea, 3o vero lapidea
Maria optimam partem elegit. Luc. x. Qui uero in assumpcione matris Domini
digne possumus ad conuiuium dominicum accedere debeamus nos vestire et preparare virtutibus predictis ne nobis dicatur 'Amice quomodo intrasti non habens vestem nuptialem' Mt. xxij. Ad Colos.
Ad conuiuium vero sacramentale attende
Vos estis templum Dei uiui ... ii Cor. iiio. Verba proposita conuenienter possunt exponi de templo spirituali fidelis anime
msItem.note: Schneyer 2. 670 (Henricus de Friemar, 430); Schneyer 8. 782 (Anon. in Clm 28382, 46)

msItem.title: De dedicatione
msItem.incipit: Uidi ciuitatem sanctam Iherusalem ... Apocc. xxi. Verba proposita que scribuntur in epistula hodierna, spiritualiter intellecta possunt esse dicta in persona militantis ecclesie

msItem.title: Sequitur sermo de sancto Matheo
msItem.incipit: Notandum quod nos legimus Christum recubuisse in 4or domibus ad comedendum
In nomine Domini amen. Notandum quod beatus Matheus spiritualiter secutus fuit Cristum

msItem.title: De octo beatitudinibus
msItem.incipit: Videns Ihesus turbas ... Math. Hodie sancta mater ecclesia ipsius sancti sanctorum

msItem.rubric: Sequitur iam sermo de sancta Elizabeth
msItem.incipit: Considerauit semitas domus sue ... Prouerb. 31. Verba proposita convenienter assumitur in laudem et preconium in honorem beate Elisabeth

msContents.summary: Emerging from beneath a paper pastedown is a parchment pastedown, which appears to contain German text. No entire words are visible though the text is clearly in German. This is the first of four other identifiable fragments of the same document in this manuscript. Other fragments are visible between fols. 12v-13r (stub 1), 12v-13r (stub 2), 326v-327r (stub 1), and as the rear pastedown.

msItem.title: Cartulary of Franciscan convent in Erfurt

msItem.incipit: vnd vnsern gotishusz ewiclich bliben vnd sollen des nymande zugebin vorbasz nie plichtig sy

(recto) ans vom Eckirsberge Techand czu Nuwenburg
eyne gemeyne herberge czu mulhusz odir czu saltza war vns dy vorgenantin koufer odir

(verso) magse vnd were dy vns der vorgenanten er berld koufer gutlich gantz
Jare an deme tage der heilgen Aposteln
msItem.note: This is evidently the continuation of the document underneath the paper pastedown on the inside front cover. The text is in two columns.

Between these two leaves are two stubs, the first parchment, containing German text, and the second paper, containing Latin text. Both are associated with the flyleaves at the end of the book. The first (parchment) stub contains three lines of visible text on either side, in two columns.
msItem.incipit:
(recto) vorbaz an vnsern nutz vnd vromen wiszintlich gewant habin noch rate vnser frunde vnd dez selbin geldez
czusant worden Era dominorum de Saltza Antiquorum super pensio Guntheri gotschalci in Isenack

(verso) gestrengin herre Ditherich von wytzeleiben er cze von Blyken Blywen ditherich von Bernwal ander lute den wol ist czu geloubin
yre nochkomen hene heischin vnd sullin vnd wollin dar Inleger halden alse lange biz diz der vorgenante Bernhard vnd sime erbin vorkoufer dy ansprache
(left-hand column) te Kylians tage Nach Cristi geburte dry hundirt iar In dem tzwei vnd achtzigestem jare ntique fratre super bonis in Saltza et censibus Reynhart ratgebe houbtman Czu Mulhu
msItem.explicit: (left-hand column) fyer hůnre jerlicher vnd ewiger gulde czu cristene vnd czu gebene alle jar vff sente Mi hels tag in dren Milen von der stad czu Saltza
msItem.incipit: (right-hand column) dez czu warem orkunde vnser icklich eygin Ingesigel an des brief by dez vorgenantin vorkoufers Insegil wiszintlichin laszen hengin · vnd ich vorgenanten Reynhard Ratgebe vorkoufer
msItem.explicit: (right-hand column) Item Ekkehard goszwin gebt von eyme vyrteile landes eyn vyrteil weyszis eyn vyrteil rocken vnd eyn vyrteil gersten Item Heinrich heyse gebit von eyme vyrteil swides
msItem.note: The rear pastedown contains the final, and most complete, of the four fragments of the same document preserved in the binding of this manuscript. Two columns are visible; in each 21 lines of text are visible. The document has been cut at the left with loss of text. From this text we can see that the document is a record of all the donations and endowments, copied out from charters, relating to the Franciscan convent in Erfurt.
See further: Zumkeller, A., ‘MSS. des Augustinereremitenordens’, Augustiniana 15 (1965), here p. 270.

revisionDesc.change: Description revised for Polonsky digitization project to include additional information from printed descriptions.
